meanings.definition: Regard as probable; expect or predict.
meanings.sent1: I anticipate a sunny day tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She anticipates a busy week ahead.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to anticipate the arrival of its owner.
meanings.sent4: The detective tried to anticipate the suspect's next move.
meanings.sent5: I always anticipate traffic during rush hour.

meanings.definition: Act as a forerunner or precursor of.
meanings.sent1: The dark clouds anticipate the storm's arrival.
meanings.sent2: The first snowflakes anticipate the coming winter.
meanings.sent3: The early morning birds anticipate the sunrise.
meanings.sent4: The distant thunder anticipates the approaching storm.
meanings.sent5: The falling leaves anticipate the arrival of autumn.

meanings.sent1: I anticipate meeting my friend for lunch.
meanings.sent2: They anticipate the start of the weekend.
meanings.sent3: The children anticipate the arrival of Santa Claus.
meanings.sent4: She eagerly anticipates her birthday celebration.
meanings.sent5: We anticipate the release of the new movie.
